snippet: In what has been the most news-filled summer in recent memory, our leaders in the media-political class “started a conversation,” whatever that means.
abstract: Mark Leibovich Your Fellow Americans column contends that press coverage of protests in Ferguson, Mo, typifies how the line between participant and observer has blurred.
lead_paragraph: In what has been the most news-filled summer in recent memory, our leaders in the media-political class “started a conversation,” whatever that means.

headline.print_headline: Let Us All Bear Witness to the Conversation!
headline.main: How Many Outsiders Does It Take to ‘Bear Witness’ in Ferguson?
